entry.def: If you refill something, you fill it again after it has been emptied.

example.tran: 我再次斟满了我们的酒杯。

entry.def: A refill of a particular product, such as soap powder, is a quantity of that product sold in a cheaper container than the one it is usually sold in. You use a refill to fill the more permanent container when it is empty.

example.ex: Refill packs are cheaper and lighter.

means.word_mean: 1. a prescription drug that is provided again;

sentences.sentence: "he got a refill of his prescription"

means.word_mean: 2. a commercial product that refills a container with its appropriate contents;

sentences.sentence: "he got a refill for his ball-point pen"
"he got a refill for his notebook"

means.word_mean: 1. fill something that had previously been emptied;

sentences.en: Drink up,then I’ll refill your glass.
